post.title: EU passing Article 13
post.body: Well it sure looks dark now. Article 13 has been passed for good within the EU. EU member states will have 2 years to implement these new laws. What this means in every individual member state is uncertain however I would strongly recommend anyone in the EU to invest in a VPN when that day comes and to stand up now against this. I will be getting a VPN and using services like ZeroNet more.

post.title: Changing the look of Windows
post.body:
So I was bored the other day and decided to change the look of my Windows 10 installation. I ended up installing the Arc theme by user niivu on Deviantart and the icon pack also by niivu.
[Theme](https://www.deviantart.com/niivu/art/Arc-704024954)
[Icon pack](https://www.deviantart.com/art/Arc-iPack-704026527)
Other tweaks are oldnewexplorer, classicshell and wallpaper engine for a pretty and functional desktop experience even on Windows. Some parts of the OS definitely look flaky at best like the task manager.
**Pretty desktop screenshot**
![Windows with arc dark theme](img/LookOfWindows/rice.png)
**Task manager looking uglier than ever**
![Task manager with white and dark bits](img/LookOfWindows/uglyrice.png)

**UPDATE: For some reason the task manager decided to fix itself.**
![Fixed task manager](img/LookOfWindows/fixedforsomereason.png)

Conclusion I guess, this was rather pointless and the result is mixed. Especially with Firefox for some reason which I noticed on Ubuntu as well. Strange.

post.title: My first blog
post.body:
I've never used any blogs before, I came here due to the vote that the EU had today (12/Sep/2018).

I was tipped off about ZeroNet by a person on a chat server and looking at their official site it made me intrigued.

I like the idea and implementation of ZeroNet so I will probably stay but not use this for all of my online needs since there isn't much content or a big community here. I am willing to bet though that if article 11 & 13 pass and are written into law next year and people finding that the content they upload is getting taken down for "copyright infringement" they will either switch to a VPN or using hidden services like ZeroNet or TOR for spreading things such as memes.

If nothing else using ZeroNet will be an experience different to the clearnet.

post.title: Congratulations!
post.body: Your zeronet blog has been successfully created!
